labels: British Army military slang or Canada
definitions.label_groups: dated , British Army military slang or Canada , US , colloquial

definitions.definition: Any germ or contaminant , real or imagined , especially from the opposite gender (for pre- pubescent children).
examples: I’m not drinking from his glass until I wash the cooties off it.
definitions.label_groups: Canada , US , Australia , colloquial , childish , usually in the plural

definitions.definition: A nest-building female American coot (counterpart to cooter ).
A sideswiper , a type of telegraph key.

main_definition: ( dated , British Army military slang or Canada , US , colloquial ) A louse ( Pediculus humanus ).
secondary_definitions: ( Canada , US , Australia , colloquial , childish , usually in the plural ) Any germ or contaminant , real or imagined , especially from the opposite gender (for pre- pubescent children).
( rare ) A nest-building female American coot (counterpart to cooter ).
( rare , slang ) A sideswiper , a type of telegraph key.
